content.html: Word of the day is to 'noggle' something: 19th-century English dialect meaning to manage something with difficulty/to just about scrape through. (As in 'I could barely get out of bed this morning, but I noggled it somehow'.)
content.value:
Word of the day is to 'noggle' something: 19th-century English dialect meaning to manage something with difficulty/to just about scrape through. 

(As in 'I could barely get out of bed this morning, but I noggled it somehow'.)
